1.long: elder, usually used as subst.; an elder, a member of the Sanhedrin, an elder of a Christian assembly.
(a) I send for, summon, invite, (b) I beseech, entreat, beg, (c) I exhort, admonish, (d) I comfort, encourage, console.
a witness; an eye- or ear-witness.
(a) suffering, affliction, (b) passion, emotion, (c) an undergoing, an enduring.
I intend, am about to; I delay, linger.

1.brief: I uncover, bring to light, reveal
1.long: I uncover, bring to light, reveal.
honor, renown; glory, an especially divine quality, the unspoken manifestation of God, splendor.

2.long: I shepherd, tend, herd; hence: I rule, govern.
by way of compulsion, unwillingly, by force, necessarily.
willingly, of one's own accord, spontaneously.

2.brief: down from, against, according to, throughout, during
2.long: gen: against, down from, throughout, by; acc: over against, among, daily, day-by-day, each day, according to, by way of.
greedily, in a spirit of eagerness for base gain.
readily, eagerly, with a ready mind, cheerfully.

3.brief: as, like as, how, while, so that
3.long: as, like as, about, as it were, according as, how, when, while, as soon as, so that.
I exercise authority over, overpower, master.
(a) a lot, (b) a portion assigned; hence: a portion of the people of God assigned to one's care, a congregation.
(originally: the mark of a blow, then a stamp struck by a die), (a) a figure; a copy, image, (b) a pattern, model, (c) a type, prefiguring something or somebody.

3.brief: I come into being, am born
3.long: I come into being, am born, become, come about, happen.

4.brief: I make clear, visible, or manifest
4.long: I make clear (visible, manifest), make known.

(a) act: I convey, bring, carry, (b) mid: I receive back, receive what has belonged to myself but has been lost, or else promised but kept back, or: I get what has come to be my own by earning, recover.
honor, renown; glory, an especially divine quality, the unspoken manifestation of God, splendor.

5.long: in like manner, similarly, in the same way, equally.
I place under, subject to; mid, pass: I submit, put myself into subjection.
elder, usually used as subst.; an elder, a member of the Sanhedrin, an elder of a Christian assembly.

5.brief: all, the whole, every kind of
5.long: all, the whole, every kind of.

5.brief: but, on the other hand, and
5.long: a weak adversative particle, generally placed second in its clause; but, on the other hand, and.
I clothe myself (originally: I tie round in a knot).
that, since, because; may introduce direct discourse.
I set myself against, resist (the attack of).
humble, lowly, in position or spirit (in a good sense).

5.brief: but, on the other hand, and
5.long: a weak adversative particle, generally placed second in its clause; but, on the other hand, and.
I offer, give; I put, place.
(a) grace, as a gift or blessing brought to man by Jesus Christ, (b) favor, (c) gratitude, thanks, (d) a favor, kindness.

6.long: I make or bring low, humble, humiliate; pass: I am humbled.
(a) I raise on high, lift up, (b) I exalt, set on high.
fitting season, season, opportunity, occasion, time.

7.brief: all, the whole, every kind of
7.long: all, the whole, every kind of.

7.brief: on, to, against, on the basis of, at
7.long: on, to, against, on the basis of, at.

7.brief: he, she, it, they, them, same
7.long: he, she, it, they, them, same.
that, since, because; may introduce direct discourse.

7.brief: he, she, it, they, them, same
7.long: he, she, it, they, them, same.

7.brief: it is a care, it concerns
7.long: it is a care, it is an object of anxiety, it concerns.

8.long: (lit: I am sober), I am calm (vigilant), circumspect.

8.brief: I am awake, am vigilant, watch
8.long: (a) I am awake (in the night), watch, (b) I am watchful, on the alert, vigilant.
(adj. used often as a noun), slanderous; with the article: the Slanderer (par excellence), the Devil.

8.brief: as, like as, how, while, so that
8.long: as, like as, about, as it were, according as, how, when, while, as soon as, so that.
I roar, howl, as a beast.
I walk, hence Hebraistically (in an ethical sense): I conduct my life, live.
I seek, search for, desire, require, demand.
any one, some one, a certain one or thing.
I drink down, swallow, devour, destroy, consume.

9.brief: I take a stand against, oppose, resist
9.long: I set against; I withstand, resist, oppose.
faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.

9.brief: he, she, it, they, them, same
9.long: he, she, it, they, them, same.
(a) suffering, affliction, (b) passion, emotion, (c) an undergoing, an enduring.
the world, universe; worldly affairs; the inhabitants of the world; adornment.
brotherhood (in the collective sense), the members of the Christian Church, Christendom.

10.long: the, the definite article.

10.brief: but, on the other hand, and
10.long: a weak adversative particle, generally placed second in its clause; but, on the other hand, and.
(a) God, (b) a god, generally.

10.brief: all, the whole, every kind of
10.long: all, the whole, every kind of.
(a) grace, as a gift or blessing brought to man by Jesus Christ, (b) favor, (c) gratitude, thanks, (d) a favor, kindness.
the, the definite article.

you.
into, in, unto, to, upon, towards, for, among.
the, the definite article.
age-long, and therefore: practically eternal, unending; partaking of the character of that which lasts for an age, as contrasted with that which is brief and fleeting.

10.brief: he, she, it, they, them, same
10.long: he, she, it, they, them, same.

in, on, among.
anointed; the Messiah, the Christ.

10.brief: he, she, it, they, them, same
10.long: he, she, it, they, them, same.

(a) I fit (join) together; met: I compact together, (b) act. and mid: I prepare, perfect, for his (its) full destination or use, bring into its proper condition (whether for the first time, or after a lapse).
(a) I fix firmly, direct myself towards, (b) generally met: I buttress, prop, support; I strengthen, establish.
I strengthen.
I found, lay the foundation (lit. and met.).

dominion, strength, power; a mighty deed.
into, in, unto, to, upon, towards, for, among.

11.brief: an age, a cycle of time
11.long: an age, a cycle (of time), especially of the present age as contrasted with the future age, and of one of a series of ages stretching to infinity.

11.brief: an age, a cycle of time
11.long: an age, a cycle (of time), especially of the present age as contrasted with the future age, and of one of a series of ages stretching to infinity.

11.brief: verily, truly, amen, so let it be
11.long: verily, truly, amen; at the end of sentences may be paraphrased by: So let it be.

12.long: (a) gen: through, throughout, by the instrumentality of, (b) acc: through, on account of, by reason of, for the sake of, because of.
Silvanus, a Roman citizen and a helper of Paul.
you.
the, the definite article.
trustworthy, faithful, believing.
a brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian.

and, even, also, namely.

this; he, she, it.

trans: (a) I make to stand, place, set up, establish, appoint; mid: I place myself, stand, (b) I set in balance, weigh; intrans: (c) I stand, stand by, stand still; met: I stand ready, stand firm, am steadfast.

13.brief: I greet, salute, pay my respects to
13.long: I greet, salute, pay my respects to, welcome.
(a) Babylon, the ancient city on the Euphrates, to which the people of Jerusalem, etc., were transported, (b) hence allegorically of Rome, from the point of view of the Christian people.
Mark, who also had the Hebrew name John, son of Mary, nephew of Barnabas, coadjutor of Barnabas, Paul, and Peter.

14.brief: I greet, salute, pay my respects to
14.long: I greet, salute, pay my respects to, welcome.
love, benevolence, good will, esteem; plur: love-feasts.
peace, peace of mind; invocation of peace a common Jewish farewell, in the Hebraistic sense of the health (welfare) of an individual.

14.brief: all, the whole, every kind of
14.long: all, the whole, every kind of.
